item.title: Leonardo Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Leonardo Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsSeptember 23, 2025Leonardo S.p.A.is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities found in the following product: Leonardo SC2.

item.title: Azure Access Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Azure Access Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsSeptember 23, 2025Azure Access Technologyis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for Azure Access branded products and technologies only.

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on August 20 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on August 20 Now AvailablenewsSeptember 30, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on August 20, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on September 3 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on September 3 Now AvailablenewsSeptember 30, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on September 3, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Join the CVE Program’s Automation Working Group (AWG)!
item.description: Join the CVE Program’s Automation Working Group (AWG)!newsSeptember 30, 2025TheCVE Automation Working Group (AWG)plays a key role in shaping how theCVE™ Programuses technology to improve automation, streamline data exchange, and modernize services for the global vulnerability management community.

item.title: Almaviva Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Almaviva Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsSeptember 30, 2025Almaviva S.p.A.is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in Almaviva proprietary software solutions such as Joshua CybeRisk Vision, Jiano, Sofia, and Giotto, as well as Almaviva-developed IT solutions.

item.title: CVE Program Operational Update
item.description: CVE Program Operational UpdatenewsSeptember 30, 2025In the event of a potential lapse of federal appropriations, theCommon Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE™) Programwishes to reassure the global cybersecurity community that CVE’s essential functions will continue without interruption.

item.title: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 252 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for October 6, 2025
item.description: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 252 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for October 6, 2025blogBy CVE Program|October 7, 2025

item.title: Early Registration Now Open forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026on April 13-16, 2026!
item.description: Early Registration Now Open forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026on April 13-16, 2026!blogBy CVE Program|October 7, 2025CVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026

item.title: Xona Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Xona Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsOctober 7, 2025Xona Systemsis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for all software produced as part of the Xona Platform including the CSG (Critical System Gateway) and XCM (Xona Central Manager) and vulnerabilities discovered by or reported to Xona Systems for Xona software or its underlying Operating System or Firmware not covered by the scope of another CNA.
